column1: Adanedhel was another name for Túrin
column2: the son of Húrin and Morwen.  Although a Men
column3: he had been raised from childhood in the halls of King Thingol of Doriath.  When
column5: he dwelt among the Elves of Nargothrond
column6: they recognised the nobility he had acquired in Thingols kingdom
column7: and gave him the name Adanedhel
column8: meaning Elf-man (Adan means "man" and edhel means "elf").
